review.reviewBody: Sic pump! Dude Pogi and his 165 cranks ain’t got nuttin on this hefty fella crankin a 54x11 with these new cleats!!! #ImAwesome
review.name: Brovid 19

review.reviewBody: Got these for backup / spare some time back. Kept indoors with other cycling stuff in tempature controllled room. Rubber has detached and disintegrated. For comparision i have spare Mavic cleats also bought a while back, tubes etc - all in pristine condition. This could be a safety issue.
review.name: Poor quality

review.reviewBody: Works great, high float, just as advertised. Just be sure to replace them once they do wear out
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: These cleats are easy to install and click in/ click out are so easy. I was new to the clipless pedals and a little hesitant. The Shimano road shoe and cleat system were recommended by my bike shop 2 years ago and love the simplicity. Purchased an extra pair to have available on wet days and an extra set of cleats as back-up although the original pair still function perfectly. Happy with the purchase.
review.name: Form fit function!

review.reviewBody: This is all I use now on all my shoes. I used look cleats for a while. Tried these and I?ve been using them for 3 years on all my shoes now. Reliable , durable and well made.
review.name: The best !

name: SPD-SL Cleat Set

review.reviewBody:
I’m 6’1”, 240lbs and an XL fits me perfect. 
It’s light, stretchy and comfortable. It’s a great packable rain shell. 
Two things I would change though, I would love a loop inside to hang it up with if I don’t use a hanger, and I wish the hood had a cinch chord to snug it the hood up when I’m not using the hood. 

All in all, a good product from OR

Overall I love the feel of this jacket.  It's light weight and the inside doesn't feel like a plastic bag on your skin.  It's a rain jacket so it's always going to feel a little clammy but this is the best I've felt.  The stretch really sets this jacket apart from others.  I don't feel like my arm mobility is restricted at all.
Typical use is for every-day use and day-hikes.  I haven't worn it in any sort of torrential downpours but so far it seems like it's doing a great job.
6'4" - Large fits well - arms are plenty long enough
review.name: Great feeling rain jacket

review.reviewBody: Great, thin,  packable, breathable shell!. I have thicker ski jackets but  this one is great for hiking or MTB'ing. fits in my pack easily and breathes!
great jacket, great customer service, great company
review.name: excellent outdoor company

review.reviewBody: Great jacket for cycling , hiking, cross country skiing. It’s my go to jacket.
review.name: My all year jacket.

review.reviewBody: Fits great, comfortable and easy to move around in.
Very lightweight. Completely waterproof. My one criticism is that the arms should taper down to the wrist for a better fit adjustment at the wrist.
review.name: Nice Jacket

review.reviewBody:
Outdoor Research just makes quality gear. Kept me dry, inside and out, on a rainy/snowy hike in Southern Utah. Comfortable and packs up very small.
The hood adjustment was a bit fiddley but once set was great.
This a bit pricey for a beginner, but when you know the value of great gear it's a bargain. I wear a medium size normally but got this in large to allow layering. It comfortably allows for warm layers without drowning me over just a tee.
review.name: Great Jacket For Wet Adventures

review.reviewBody: The jacket is lightweight and true-to-size. Repels water well and is comfortable. Couldn't ask for a better jacket.
review.name: Stratoburst Rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: I used this jacket on wilderness pack trips, the zipper blew out about 2 trips in and I had hardly used it. The material would rip rather easily. Seemed like a good product, might just not be strong enough to handle what it needed to in those conditions.

name: Stratoburst Stretch Rain Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love how lightweight this is! I sized up for layering. I usually wear an XL and ordered and XXL. But I think the XL would have been perfect, the XXL has extra room even with layering. It’s thin and warm but I love that it is not bulky while driving.
review.name: LOVE!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this!! Perfect length (body and sleeves!). Love the addition of the thumb holes. Very warm without the bulk. I'm 5' 4" and about 135 lbs. and got a Medium so I could wear over sweaters. Flattering fit!
review.name: Just What I Wanted!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm and lightweight. Happy with this purchase. Soft interior hood.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: I should have read reviews before purchasing. Jacket came out of the wash with lots of stains on it. Almost look like grease stains, washed it twice but makes it worse. I am so disappointed, I really need a jacket and don’t want to have to wait 4 weeks for a refund.
review.name: Disappointed
comment: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We appreciate you as a Columbia customer and your feedback is what helps us improve. Please reach out if you need further assistance.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for my daughter and she loves it! It's warm but light weight and looks fantastic!
review.name: The perfect winter coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this jacket, not only is it warm but it’s so stylish. Love the hand gloves inside, probably my favorite part
review.name: Love this jacket!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Highly recommend this long jacket (with Omni-heat in its lining). I ordered this for my sister (I already own one for myself), and my sister just fell in love with it. It was her 2024 birthday gift. Just an outstanding jacket for 30 degrees and higher. Mine is the brown color and got her the dark chalk color, I think it's called.
review.name: I recommend this warm jacket!

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for a trip because I hoped it would be easy to pack. I was right! It is so warm and comfortable. I love the double-ended zipper. It packed easily in my suitcase. It washes and dries brilliantly. Also, got it for considerably less money on Backcountry vs. Columbia or other online retailers.
review.name: I love this jacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the jacket keeps you warm with its Omni Heat protection inside. I bought 3 jackets similar to this with the Omni heat protection.
review.name: Excellent light weight jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat is very warm!! I love the hood!! Very good quality!
review.name: Very warm

review.itemreviewed: Facet 75 Alpha Outdry Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was not too sure of purchasing these shoes, as I was going to use strickly for hiking and am a large guy and require a lot of support.. A little tough getting the shoes on at first as the material is really tight. Tip: Instead of normal socks, used a silky sock and feet slipped right in.. Hiked about several miles with my dogs through water, rocks and tall grass. Supported my feet, arch and ankle throughout and when off, my feet did not ache later on that night. I love these shoes, they are quite comfortable, supportive and have an aggressive traction.. Going to wear out and then buy anther pair.
review.name: Worth the money 100%

hasVariant.name: 1500 Battery + Charger
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond 1500 Battery + Charger online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought this on sale for my old storm 400. Just to find out it doesn’t fit that model. Batteries require extra shipping care. So sending it back doesn’t make sense.
review.name: Bought this on sale for

review.reviewBody: Why does this have a separate charging dock required and not just a USB port like the petzl battery? Why doesn't it fit in other headlamps with flat and open battery box designs? Before long someone is going to need to create some standards in the major headlamp makers, just like what happened with sleeping pads and R value. OR JUST LIKE HOW AAA IS A STANDARD BATTERY SIZE. I don't want more stuff to lug around and lose like a charging dock. The ability to use this in place of AAA batteries should be a standard in headlamp design. . . however in the petzl headlamps I cannot use the BD battery, and in BD headlamps I can't use the petzl battery. . . . HOWEVER: Petzl created a flat no frills design to plug and play their battery interchangeable with AAAs. BD seems to have purposely designed their battery to not work in even the simplest petzl headlamp which is an open box to accept any battery design. BD has chosen to make their battery too thick and include ridges and bumps to prevent compatibility. If my team, or climbing party, or hunting group is out and we needed to swap batteries (bad on us for preparedness) but seriously when you're walking all night up and down mountains light can become vitally important and you shouldn't make it harder for teams to operate gear interchangeably. Get together with some other brands and do something good for us all in the outdoor industry and the environment considering battery production and not just your company.
review.name: 2 stars because it works. . . otherwise 1

review.reviewBody: Love the dual fuel technology, I had a couple already and was looking for just the batteries, but they were unfortunately out of stock so needed to get the combo. BD should always have the batteries in stock! In a 2 pack or 4 pack would be awesome.
review.name: Awesome product...but

review.reviewBody: What a great thing to have a hybrid system. Bravo.
review.name: Five stars.

review.reviewBody: This is great as it saves on disposable batteries and works with a variety of BD products. 4 stars only because the proprietary charger is one more thing to lose. It'd be great to see this battery with some sort of universal charging option.
review.name: versatile battery

review.reviewBody: I like these rechargeable batteries, so handy! The only thing I don't know is whether or not it is waterproof.
review.name: I like these

review.reviewBody: I bought this battery and charger to avoid having to purchase or carry batteries on the trail for my headlamp.  It works great.
review.name: Recharge vs Battery

review.reviewBody: The perfect option to continue using an amazing product!
review.name: battery

review.reviewBody: Battery pack is a great addition to the headlamp. I like having the option to use AAA batteries or the pack. Great for hiking, working on the 4Runner, or house projects.
review.name: Customer for Life

review.reviewBody: I'm excited to finally have a rechargeable battery (and the associated headlamp) for my bike commute to work.
review.name: Great for commuting

name: 1500 Battery + Charger

review.reviewBody: I completely adore this tote bag!! It has become my everyday purse!
review.name: In LOVE!!

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag as a gift for my niece for her 1st year in college. She is a petite lady, and the size fits her perfectly. I was surprised the bag is very spacious, it fits her iPad and one big book for class. Our favorite feature are the straps that can be worn in 3 ways.
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased this bag, and overall, I'm quite satisfied with it. The size is excellent and can hold a surprising amount of items, making it perfect for daily use or travel. However, I found the outer side pockets to be a bit of a letdown. They are too tight to hold anything substantial, which limits their functionality. Additionally, there's no place to clip items on the outside of the bag, which would have been a nice feature for added convenience. I bought the pink color, and it looks quite different from the online photos. It appears as a pale pink in the pictures, but in person, it's a much hotter pink. Despite these minor issues, it's still a sturdy and reliable bag that serves its primary purpose well.
review.name: Practical but Could Use Some Improvements

review.reviewBody: Cute mini totepack. Great idea, but not very functional if it does not fit my small water bottles. It only gets 3 stars because I honestly bought it to fit two of hydroflask bottles (12oz and 24oz) bottles for my daily. They won't fit unless you remove the "boot" of the water bottle and fight it to fit inside. My Stanley bottle (20oz) does not even fit half way. However my Hint plastic bottle and a mini umbrella fit okay. I did not want the full size tote. I guess this is how I learn my lesson.
review.name: Don't count on the side pockets

review.reviewBody: I don't write a lot of reviews but I love this bag so it deserves one. It's a great size for almost everything: music festivals, airplane "personal item", a day at the beach, urban exploring, etc. I can even fit my 13" Macbook inside-- it's a tight fit but it does zip closed. The only things that would bring it up to 5 stars are 1. more loops to clip things onto, especially inside the bag; 2. (Common complaint) Bigger side pockets; 3. Some way to tuck the 2nd strap away when it's in "backpack mode".
The most adorable, practical and stylish tote from Kanken!
review.name: Beautiful

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this bag, it's roomier than I expected and the outer pockets keep everything I super need organized. The inner pockets are also the perfect size. I can keep my planner (I'm lost without it) in the tablet pocket with room to spare so my pen isn't pulled from the holder and lost inside, and the whole bag has way more space than my old mini backpack had. The design makes it easy to locate everything inside, and the color is beautiful.
review.name: Cute bag

review.reviewBody:
I love it! I have it navy and it's a gorgeous deep blue color. It can fit my standard size ipad with its case, along with my usual purse essentials. I wish this bag was a bit bigger so the front pocket can fit my iphone SE (2020). But I will just use it to hold my smaller trinkets instead. Love the zipper on top for easy access to my stuff.

The straps when worn as a backpack are very comfortable, but as a shoulder bag - not so much. The plastic adjusters get in the way and kind of sticks out at the bottom when the straps are pulled out all the way.

But overall a great little bag. I was afraid it would be too small but the size is perfect. I highly recommend it.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: I purchased this for my daughter for her birthday. She loves it. Great quality
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: My wife loves this little beach bag.  It?s the perfect size for necessities for a quick trip to the beach.
review.name: Beach Bag

name: Kanken Mini Totepack

review.reviewBody: Love the fleece. Excellent service
review.name: Great transaction

review.reviewBody:
Love the look of this jacket and it warm. However I’m disappointed with the way it’s wearing. The a
Insides of the arms are pilling really bad. This shouldn’t be happening to a jacket at this price
review.name: Looks great. Quality is questionable

review.reviewBody: Probably my favourite fleece. I own two. My first in dark olive is about 5 years old stood up well through outdoors work and chores got a bit bobbled but I gave it a shave not long ago and it looks as good as new. Second is a Navy one bout a year old I save for best. No bobbling or damage looks great both wash well and have good warmth. I Keep checking back for a black one but to no avail.
review.name: Bring it out in Black

review.reviewBody: I have the olive green color, have had it for 3 years now and it still looks brand new. Fits well. I got the medium, I'm 5,9" and 170 ish lbs. I have wide shoulders/athletic build and there is lots of movement in the shoulder/arm hole space which I think is great. Top quality fleece, considering getting another just in case they still making it.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody:
The Dark Navy color is NOT as the picture shows. It is much darker. It is actually darker than the Graphite color in the picture. It is, in fact, a Dark Navy color, but the picture listed as Dark Navy is not representative of the actual color.

Having said that, the fit is good and the jacket looks nice. I am 5'10", about 37" in the chest, and about 33" in the waist, and it looks good and feels like good quality. The hem rises a bit when lifting my arms directly above my head, but less than most garments, and I have good freedom of movement. 4 stars just because of the color mismatch, but if the other colors match their pictures, I'd say 5 stars.
review.name: Fjallraven Buck Fleece Jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for my husband a month ago, and he wore it during our trip to London. It's nice jacket for daily wear.
review.name: Everyday wear

review.reviewBody: This fits great and it's very warm, but the stitching inside the collar is already coming undone and the seam is coming apart. Have had this only for about 5 months now.
review.name: Geat fit and warm but...

review.reviewBody: I have MEC, and Arc'tyrex fleece but the Buck is by far my favorite. Love the high collar and over all look of it. I'm 6' 190 and find the large a bit big. I will definitely buy another color in a medium
review.name: Favorite Fleece

review.reviewBody: I love the Buck Fleece. I got it in the Fall in the Laurel Green color and wore it all throughout the winter. One of my favorite features about it is the collar. It never loses its structure. It's a warm, cozy sweater but the collar, leather details of the logo and zipper, and the chest pocket all give it a nice look. It's great as a layering piece if you're going to be in cold temps or as an outer layer if you're in moderate temps. I'm a 5'5", 110 lb woman and I got the size XS. It's relaxed in fit and a tad long in the sleeves on me but I just cuff them up. I would highly recommend this fleece for all.
review.name: Great look and comfort

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago for a race and it was the best shoe I have made in a while! Big plus for the zero drop, yet enough cushioning to not get injured during rough workouts (speedwork) and/or races. I wish there would be more shoes thought through like that. Extra plus the wide toes box! Sooo comfy.
review.name: Awesome running shoe

review.reviewBody: I recently started running and I've only used these for about 45 miles. The soles of the heel are already worn away. For the price of these shoes, it is absurd for them to be worn out so quickly.
review.name: Wears way too fast

review.reviewBody: The sneaker is extremely hard to slide into and fold of fabric do not lay flat do it bunches to the left and right of the tongue and on the sides of the sneaker. Laces are some sort of man made fiber and they come untied too often, slippery so the bow does not stay. Once you get the sneaker on its comfortable. I forgot my first time purchase code at the time of order and they fixed that. Good customer service. I will buy another pair, should gave returned these. But again once they are on and you fix those folds of fabric it is good.
review.name: Once Shoe is on its good

review.reviewBody: I've been wanting to try shoes with carbon as I train for my next race. I definitely feel the spring in these!! I've been faster every time I've worn them on my long runs, I can't wait to take them to the streets of Paris for the marathon. I only wish they had support for pronation, but maybe that would interfere with the "spring". In any case... I'm hooked
review.name: Zippy!!

review.reviewBody: Putting aside the fact that I had to go up half a size in these from my other running shoes, they've become my favorite shoe for races and long runs. They don't give me blisters nearly as quickly as the torin 6s, they don't squish my toes like the torin 7s. I wore these for a recent marathon and my feet didn't feel completely destroyed afterward the way they have in past long races. HOWEVER, I agree with some of the other reviews about how fast the tread wears down. A few weeks after my marathon I wore these same shoes for a 10k fun run, where I nearly hit the pavement 3 or 4 times because it had rained the night before and my heel tread had worn down so much that I was slipping right and left. The shoes had only had about 120 miles on them when I finished the marathon, which given the price I'd paid was a bit disappointing. Also, I'd worn those same shoes to run in the rain before so when the tread was intact they were okay, but by the time I did the 10k they'd worn down to the white part underneath.
review.name: SO comfortable. Wish they lasted longer.

review.reviewBody: I've been excited to try a carbon race shoe, but the price tag has held me back. I'm a loyal Altra fan and decided to save up and get them for a big race I was training for because everyone said they swear by carbon sneakers. They did not disappoint! I trained twice in them before the race; PR'd in my race and couldn't wait to wear them for my next event! They are comfy and springy just like everyone said! I knew that they did not have the mileage like a regular running shoe, but for the price I was hoping for at least 150-200 miles.... There weren't even 100 miles on them!!! I bought them in November for my half marathon and only wore them twice before the for 2 speed works outs which was a total of about 6 miles each, then my half marathon. Which I PR'd big! Put them away until my next race. Again I did 2 speed workouts between 5-6 miles each before my 10 mile race and PR'd again!! After that race I was shocked to see how extremely worn they were on the sides of the soles, I mean as if I wore them for months running! I showed my running store where I bought them, they too were shocked at the wear, but they were past the 60 day warranty so they told me to contact Altra. I have friends who have carbon race shoes by other name brands and couldn't believe how worn mine were. The upper shoe looks like new. Some were getting 200 miles out of the other brands. For that price point I was extremely disappointed with the quality of the soles for not having even 100 miles on them and were purchased specifically for races. I normally run in torins to train in and to race in. The Torins I bought this summer, don't even have that kind of wear on them. Anyway, for comfort and speed these would have been my favorite race shoe of all time, seriously, I ran with no aches or pains and felt fabulous after my 2 races, but unless you have money to blow on a few training runs and a race or two I would not recommend these at all. :-(
review.name: Would have been my favorite shoe but....

review.reviewBody: I started running during COVID and progressed through 5k, 10k, 10 miles, and half marathons on 8-10mm drop racing shoes and trainers, but also with injury after injury. In April of 2023, my new physical therapists recommended a switch to a zero drop shoe. I tried Topos, then Altras, and finally the Vanish Carbon. The Fall racing season, I PR'd in the 5k and half marathon, and ran my first marathon. All injury free! Thank you to Altra and the Vanish Carbon! I'm on my 3rd pair and have easily gotten 500km each pair with zero problems (with my feet or the shoes). The dye does come off on my socks so I switched from white to dark. Not a problem. For me, this shoe is perfect. I'll run London in April, Berlin in September.
review.name: Perfect road running shoe for me!

review.reviewBody: After 3 half marathons the tread was completely worn out. Not worth the money.
review.name: I would not buy again

review.reviewBody: I run the Monterey Half Marathon in the Vanish Carbon and loved running in them. The amount of cushion felt perfect to me. I noticed a considerable difference in how much longer I could go in these shoes before my legs fatigued. The spring in these shoes helped my speed and I set two PR's on race weekend since I also run a 5k the day before. They felt great for my joints. The fit it is extremely comfortable. The upper is very soft and light.Even though these are narrower than other Altra models and I have bunions they still felt wide enough to be comfortable for all 13 miles. I even wore toe spacers comfortably. They are amazing for racing and long runs. However, I wouldn't recommend these for training, they might weaken your legs and feet. A couple of things they could improve - the tong is very thin and flimsy and it rides down as I run bunching up at the bottom of the shoe. Most shoes have a loop in the tong where you could lace it up but not in these shoes, there is no way to secure the tong. However this did not bother me one bit while I was running. It just looks bad. Also, my heel was slipping in the shoe but again, this did not bother me. I worried me at first that it might cause friction or make it unstable but this was not the case. I think maybe the cushion around the ankle somehow makes it less secure even though they are trying to do the opposite. Nonetheless, they provide a stable ride. I'm 43 and I've been running for 15 years. All in all these provide the best running experience of any shoe I've run on. They are pricey but worth it.
review.name: PR setter

review.reviewBody: After the first run, there was wear & tear. Then 86 miles in, there were dime-sized holes in both soles. I sent pix to Altra: they claimed "normal wear and tear" and dropped it. Altra lost a loyal customer.
review.name: At 86 miles, both shoes had holes in the soles.

name: Vanish Carbon Running Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Recon 3.0 Mountain Bike Shoe online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
My previous pair of shoes was the S Works, perfect shoe, but I got those on a deal, and I didn't want to spend $400 on new S Works.

These are great except for one terrible flaw--the upper BOA lace goes through a plastic triangle guide on top of the tongue, and if you tighten the upper BOA at all, that plastic guide digs into the top of your foot, at the ankle. I now have permanent red marks. I'm going to try to cut that piece out, but not sure if it will work. Fingers crossed.
review.name: Great shoe, terrible BOA placement

review.reviewBody: I purchased a pair of these shoes, not from backcountry (they were out of stock in my size). They are oddly narrow and I don’t have wide feet at all. Also, everything people say about the shoes digging into your ankle and the boa dial digging in on the side of the shoe is true. I tried to post a review on specialized’s website and they wouldn’t post it on there’d
review.name: Not good shoes

review.reviewBody:
It was time to climb the ladder...  I upgraded from a Recon 2.0 which was a great shoe.  This shoe provides much better power transfer and has a much better closure system due to the dual boas.  
On a side note,  if you do have to hike-a-bike these may not be that great due to the stiff carbon outsole but the Stride Toe Flex area does provide some flexibility and does make the shoe hikeable. 
Great shoe if you are looking for Sworks features at a lower price point.

Note on sizing, I wear a us12 / 30cm, size purchased was a eu46 with no fit issues.
review.name: Can't go wrong..

review.reviewBody: I have been using a pair of Recon 1.0 shoes for about a year now with great results. Due to a Morton's Nueroma, I prefer a moderately wide footbox (even if the fit is sightly sloppy) and the Recon 1.0's have worked quite well for me.  The 1.0s are really comfortable (for my foot shape), are reasonably stiff when pedaling, and the hiking comfort and traction has been impressive on Tahoe granite.  I purchased the Recon 3.0s because they were on sale and looked like a nice upgrade.  The fit and finish of the 3.0s look great and they retain all of the 1.0's comfort with one notable exception (for me).  As soon as I took my first step on carpet, I felt a pretty unpleasant pressure point on the inner side of the upper tongue --right under the BOA strap.  It may be the exact same fit issue that others have noted but I knew immediately that the upper BOA strap on the 3.0s would not work for my foot shape.   Just an fyi, other than my need for a slightly wider toe box,  I have a completely average foot (i.e. normal arch, no bunions, etc).  I will be adding another pair of Recon 1.0s to my closet.  I guess the velcro straps simply work better for my feet.
review.name: Nicely constructed shoe.....but

review.reviewBody:
I've put a couple thousand miles on my pair of Recon 3's, used for road riding, gravel, and mountain biking. 

Pros:
- Stiff soles, great power transfer
- Boa works well, upper dial may be a tad too high and put painful pressure when dropping heels
- Very good traction
- Decently roomy toe box (way better than Giro, in my opinion)
- Drains impressively quickly
- Comfy to stand around in

Cons:
- Tongue is way too long, digs into my ankles, now I have actual scars there. In hindsight I wish I'd cut the tongue shorter on day 1.
- Sizing runs large, my normal size is too big and now I need to downsize, but Backcountry doesn't seem to carry the in-between sizes
review.name: Very good, but very flawed

review.reviewBody: Unlike other reviewers who say these are running small, I definitely found I need to size down in these. That?s why I am returning them. Otherwise they?re very comfortable. Toebox also seems spacious.
review.name: Roomy toe and overall shoe

review.reviewBody: I have been racing bikes for over 30 years and have owned multiple pairs of cycling shoes. These are the worst cycling shoes I have ever owned. They do run small. I have always loved Sidi MTB shoes but figured I would try these because they have the BOA adjustment that I love on my snowboard boots. Bad call-Horrible to walk in and they are not just uncomfortable, they are really miserable, especially if you have any minor foot issues. I tried everything as far as inserts & adjustments. I don?t write many reviews but I regret buying these and I don?t want someone else to make the same costly mistake. Wish I could return these. Don?t make the same mistake I did-buy a different pair of shoes!!!
review.name: Don?t waste your money like I did

name: Recon 3.0 Mountain Bike Shoe

The straps are everything that I read in other reviews warned about.  It's not like I was expecting Futura in a packable bag...but no carry mode actually works with these straps. They're too short for cross-body, and weirdly unbalanced for shoulder carry.

I honestly plan to destroy them to get the hardware to install on a longer strap.

review.reviewBody: I used the Mission Duffel on an Ecuador trip, and liked it so much I wanted a lighter version for short and/or light frontcountry trips, mountain biking weekends, etc. The Stuffel fits that bill. It’s a great mix of the right features without getting too fancy with gimmicks.
review.name: Well-executed, versatile bag

review.reviewBody: Easy access, multiple handles/straps for easy transport
review.name: Good product

review.reviewBody: Had enough space clothes and toiletries for a 4 night trip to Siesta Key FL (you don't need bulky clothes there) then stuffed into shared suitcase with wife. On way home, I used it as a pillow on the plane, and had snack inside too. Kind of expensive as all this vendor's items are...
review.name: Well made, tough, and functional.

review.reviewBody: Bought this because I’ve always loved the Mystery Ranch products I already own. Needed a new duffle bag and found this one. Solid quality and great features. Love it!
review.name: Love the stowaway feature!

review.reviewBody: VERY NICE PACK WITH A TON OF ROOM! I PURCHASED THIS TO MAKE A KILL KIT FOR MY ELK HUNTS!
review.name: NICE PACK!

review.reviewBody: I had return this bag but just want to say how great the company was in helping me with the return

review.reviewBody: Owned this bag for a couple months now. I love the versatility and quality. The material is thicker than I expected, but still able to fold up if needed. Happy with the purchase, price is right.
review.name: Simple, but really well made

description: Buy the Deuter Ascender 7L Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ascender 7L Hydration Backpack

hasVariant.name: Ascender 7L Hydration Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Deuter Ascender 7L Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Let me start by saying that I bought this backpack more for commuting than trail running 
 Looking for something small and light to carry my work clothes,  I usually run about 10 km to the office a few times a week in the summer.  I know it's not exactly what it was designed to do, but my issues with this pack are there regardless of discipline.  
The Good.
It's light and comfortable

the bad, 
it's not sweatproof at all.    After arriving to work the clothes in my pack are more soaked than the clothes I'm wearing during the run.   The back panel and padding seem to suck up all the sweat and distribute evening across everything in the back. 
The second drawback is the pole holder pouch,  so close to being useful, but in my opinion, it's an absolute fail.   If you aren't carrying your poles it's just flopping around and being annoying.  From what I can tell there is no way for it to be removed.    It would be perfect as a phone holder if it wasn't so light and connected to the straps.  When you put a phone, but with a phone inside, it's flapping all over the place and hitting my body.  I know it was designed for that, but still a missed opportunity.   I use one of the flask pockets to hold the phone, and that works quite well, and as it's a short run, I don't need two bottles anyway.
review.name: almost great

name: Ascender 7L Hydration Backpack

review.reviewBody: I actually purchased two of these for my Street Zen pack. I was afraid of how the window section of it would hold up. However so far it has been great and not even a scratch. Makes it real easy for me to organize and see where my items are.
review.name: Great Accessory

review.reviewBody:
I got two of these. I use one for my backpacking first aid kit, trail soap, and toothbrush. I use the other for my water treatment and backup purification tablets. They both clip on to the Metcalf calf right inside the openings - on by the side zipper, and one at the top opening. 

Any time I need either of these, they are right there by the pack opening, easy to find and access. 

Need
review.name: Organization & quick access

review.reviewBody: fits in pack nicely; good for snacks, etc/ like the orange so you can see contents easily. Only minuses are wish it came with pack (or built in) and could be a skosh larger
review.name: needed and handy addition

review.reviewBody: Super handy add on bag for inside your pack. Clips on right on top of pack so small items can be kept separate and easily viewed such as sunglasses or keys. Also easily removed if you just want more bulk storage. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great pack accessory

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my sons Metcalf for extra organization. Great product.
review.name: Great accessory

review.reviewBody: I've been searching for a bag to use between backpacks for a first aid kit for a while and came across this bag while looking at other MR packs. I bought a couple and they're working great: one for trauma and one for medical. I could see them being useful for anything from snacks to game call to anything else you want to get organized and easily accessible.
review.name: Modular first aid kit

review.reviewBody: Love this bag, opens easily and have had no problem with quality
review.name: Well made!

review.reviewBody: This is a great way to organize small gear (first aid, repair, carabiners, etc.)  for my search and rescue ready pack. The medium size fits perfectly along the sides (I bought two) of my 50 litre Coulee and makes it easier to free up the cavernous centre space of my pack for larger items.
review.name: Great addition to my Coulee 50

review.reviewBody: Bought this to give me an additional pocket inside my Coulee 20. It’s perfect. Love the window.
review.name: Perfect Accompaniment to my Coulee 20

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag to store tools (pliers, line cutters, tippet material, scale, ect.) on my bass boat casting deck. It is attached to the gunwales within easy reach. Easily removable when transporting. It is the best storage bag I found out there. Better than the manufacturers who sell them for this purpose.
review.name: Awesome storage bag!

review.itemreviewed: Manta Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These boots saved my life as I am a climber with size 14.5 feet.  These boots are fairly light and pretty rugged.  The one complaint is the lacing system doesn't really allow you to cinch tight at the bottom of the tongue.

Otherwise I really like them
review.name: Great boots w/ one flaw

review.itemreviewed: Manta Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Bought these boots a week ago and did a light 4 mile break in hike up and down this morning.  Here are my thoughts.

I was looking for a boot to use during colder weather.  Boots are lighter than I thought they would be in comparison to an older pair of Garmont leather Dakotas that I've been wearing. I would not describe them as deep winter boots for temps below zero but they should do what I need them to do most of the time in NH and Maine.  They are slightly more flexible in the upper than the Garmonts.  Fit in forefoot is a bit wider than the Garmonts.  I threw out the stock footbed and installed the Superfeet green footbed which I've always used.  They were very comfortable on the break in and no issues.

In terms of sizing, I'm wearing a medium weight sock.  I bought both a 44.5 and a 45 to compare.  With the medium weight socks, I ended up getting size 45.  The 44.5 was going to be a bit tight, though it would probably be fine as a summer boot with thin socks.  For comparison to other shoes, I wear an 44.5 in the Garmonts, a bit tight, and size 11 in Brooks Glycerin running shoes.  I wear a 10.5 in several shoes from LL Bean, the bison loafer and the Stonington shoes).  Width was very good - I have D width fairly skinny foot and leg. 

Overall, very happy with the fit.  Very comfortable.  

P
review.name: Scarpa Manta Tech GTX

name: Manta Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Cozy Lodge Cropped Cardigan Sweater - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love this sweater! It’s super cute and comfy. Love that it’s wool. It’s slightly cropped — I’m 4’10” and it comes down to the top of my hips, but I imagine it would be cropped on a taller person.
review.name: Cute and comfy

review.itemreviewed: Cozy Lodge Cropped Cardigan Sweater - Women's
review.reviewBody: This cardigan is exactly what I wanted. It is a chunky weave, slightly oversized cardigan. The quality is great and the color beautiful and rich. The arms are slightly puffed by the cuffs which adds to the style. It’s a heavy cardigan but not bulky. It is cropped but not too cropped or short. It runs true to size and hits me perfectly right above my hips and looks nice with high waisted pants. I am 5’-7” and long waisted. Overall a fun piece with great style, color and flattering fit!
review.name: Beautiful Comfy Cozy Cardigan

review.itemreviewed: Cozy Lodge Cropped Cardigan Sweater - Women's
review.reviewBody: Nice sweater, really warm and thick. The only thing is the sleeves are "puffier" than I was expecting, pay attention to the sleeve fit in the pictures. I'll still keep and I do like it, but was expecting a straighter sleeve for some reason.
review.name: Warm, high quality

review.reviewBody: They scratched on first use. Not stoked on them. they fog up and then I can't see - I think the design could be vented better. Also the strap broke on them yesterday so I now need to order a replacement.

review.name: Love ❤️

review.reviewBody:
Really disappointed in the quality of the lens 
I skied for 1 week in Utah in sunny days and had a horrible time with the sun and my view 
I need a better lens that will block the suns glare
review.name: Really disappointed in the quality

review.reviewBody: They are great for low light and stormy weather. Thanks
review.name: They are great for low

review.reviewBody: Still a bit darker than I would like but makes skiing in flat light so much better
review.name: Good for flat light conditions

review.reviewBody: Amazing…. Just skiied with them today in Deer Valley in changing conditions
review.name: Amazing…. Just skiied with them

review.reviewBody: I got the clear lens replacement. Got moisture between the lenses and fog won’t clear.
review.name: Double-layered lenses can fog in between

review.reviewBody: Yes... I have the chromaPop lens for thos 1 or 2 sunny days here in the Northeast but nearly all of the time I wear this lens. Great for low or flat light with the polarization you need. I have used mine so often ... I wore them out. Need replacements whenever the stock returns. Great lens to have as part of your "lens quiver". ... great lens for night skiing too... just sayin
review.name: Honestly ... this lens is my everyday-nearly-100% of the time lens

review.reviewBody: I love Smith products and am hoping this is a mistake on their part. Ordered I/O Mag goggles a year ago and love them. Chromapop lenses are great and have purchased a few other replacement lenses, they all fit perfectly. This clear replacement lens does not fit snug at all. It appears that there are a few magnetic pieces that are on the other lens replacements but not the clear one.
review.name: I/O Mag Clear Lens Doesn’t Fit Snug on I/O Mag Goggles

name: I/O MAG Goggles Replacement Lens - 2020+

hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Down Insulated Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The jacket is ok, the size is good and fits well (I'm 6'3" and have an athletic figure). There were a few loose threads, so I'm not sure how good the quality is. The baffle design is a little odd, with the seams going through: When you hold the jacket against the light, you can see those seams and a lot of light comes through. The jacket is very light tho, and I guess there's a trade off. I wish the logo was reflective. Would buy again when available at a discount...
review.name: Pretty good, but not perfect...

review.reviewBody: This jacket has become my go-to for cold mornings. The down insulation packs some serious warmth, even in sub-freezing temps. I'm stoked to wear it on the coldest days under my shell this ski season, but it's been great for day-to-day wear so far. The sizing runs a tiny bit large, but I don't mind some extra coverage. I love that it packs down into its own pocket, it's really nice for traveling.
review.name: Killer Puffy Jacket

review.reviewBody: I’ve owned a lot of Backcountry branded products and most of them are fantastic! Looking to see if this year Backcountry finally made a men’s Teo ALLIED Down Jacket in black, I stumbled upon this jacket. With confidence I ordered it and soon it arrived at my doorstep. After taking the jacket out of its packaging I noticed it was lacking fluff which I assumed was due to being compressed during shipping. So I hung it up and left it for a few days to see if it would get puffy. Unfortunately, it only expanded a little bit and after trying it on, it felt a bit “boxy” in the way it was cut (I ordered a large) and because of the design and lack of fluff, the seams that form the baffles offer essentially no protection from the elements. For the price, this jacket is a bit expensive compared to what you might expect. If this product was on a steep discount I’d recommend purchasing it if you intend to use it for snowboarding or under a shell. For general use, I’d recommend the Teo ALLIED Down Jacket or something comparable price wise. It’s overall a very light jacket made with good materials, just not as insulated or fitting as I’d hoped!
review.name: I wanted to like this so much!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this recently for an up-coming trip to Greenland. Purchased size MEDIUM.  I have tried it on and it fits well. I am 5'-8", 170lbs, 32"-waist and the coat fits correctly The coat has adequate room to be worn over a medium fleece and shell. I have not field tested yet because it is a very warm coat and the temps in the mid-Atalntic have been too warm. It is very compresable and appears to be quality construction.
review.name: Warm Jacket

review.reviewBody:
I use this for my walks and winter temps down to 0 degrees Fahrenheit.  Not as bully as the Positron pro that I picked up before.  Time will tell how durable it is.

I'm 5'11.5,  178 lbs with a 32 inch waist and 44 inch chest.  The medium is perfect for me when keeping 1 or 2 max slim layers.  Adding more than that would make it too snug for me.
review.name: Great fit.  Very warm!

review.reviewBody: I returned it straight away. I did not like how you could see the darker feathers, it looked like a pillow without a pillow case
review.name: I returned it straight away.

review.reviewBody:
So, I posted a review of this jacket on Rab's website. They took it down. I emailed and asked them why, and they said "we felt it was a personal opinion." In other words, they delete critical reviews of their products and only show you fake reviews and positive reviews! How sleazy!

Anyway, this is well-made but horribly tailored jacket. It tapers severely from the chest to the hem. You can see it on the model, and on anybody wearing this jacket in online reviews: the fabric is slack around the chest and stretched taut around the hips/waist. The down gets compressed, which defeats the purpose. I am not at all overweight. I'm between small and medium and I bought a medium. Still too tight for a down jacket. Sizing up won't help because the chest area would be an empty bag. Forget about layering anything underneath. Also, the main zipper is good but the pocket zippers are flimsy. Too bad because there aren't many 900fp jackets out there, and this one has a good amount of down and would be very warm if it weren't tapered so weirdly that the down gets compressed. If you have a 45-inch chest and a 25-inch waist, it will probably fit well.
review.name: Bizarre fit; beware Rab's fake reviews

review.reviewBody: Great looking jacket and super warm I use it when visiting remote sites in Scotland
review.name: Great looking jacket and super

review.reviewBody: A superlight, very packable and incredibly warm jacket. My only gripe is the hood which needs a volume adjuster - worn without a helmet , if you turn your head you can only see the inside of your hood!
review.name: Toasty!

review.reviewBody:
Excellent Jacket, packs down small and light. Great to wear and does a great job. Marmalade colour does allow the darker down to show through and I've been asked if I've got it dirty/stained already.
Thanks Rab! :)
review.name: Excellent Jacket, packs down small

review.reviewBody:
Light, warm extremely well made.
Best quality down jacket.
review.name: Light, warm extremely well made.

name: Mythic Ultra Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Tensor Trail Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Hiking the Colorado Trail as a thru-hike this summer, I started out with a Therm-a-Rest NeoAir XLite NXT sleeping pad and it developed a valve leak on day one. I was able to buy the Nemo Tensor Trail pad while on a zero day in Buena Vista.  This pad was fantastic! Very effecient and simple valve system was super reliable. I will be buying more Nemo products in the future.
review.name: Outstanding

review.reviewBody: Ounces matter. We are not all tall. When will you make a 60-66” length mattress? 66” for the higher R value model. Even if you don’t offer both mummy and rectangular at those lengths.
review.name: Sizes limited

review.reviewBody: I took this pad out for a two night backpacking trip and it was great! The sack that comes for inflating seemed like a super weird idea to me at first, but at 11,000 feet, breathing normally -- in through the nose and out through the mouth -- to fill up a sleeping pad was awesome. I didn't get lightheaded! Because it's got a lot of air between you and the ground, it was warm enough for my 38 degree night, and I even got hot. It also provides good protection from little rocks or roots, so that was great. There's a little bit of noise, but I didn't find it bothersome (my tent mate noticed it). Overall a great, light, comfortable sleeping pad! Don't be afraid to let a little air out for comfort. I found it quite uncomfortable when completely inflated.
review.name: Great, lightweight pad!

review.reviewBody: I just finished the Appalachian Trail, your product the Nemo Tensor worked and lasted 5+ months of everyday use on the trail! Well done, I am impressed!
review.name: It just worked, for the whole AT

review.reviewBody: This one of the best sleeping pads I have ever used. Its light weight and comfortable.
review.name: Good sleeping pad.

review.reviewBody: I upgraded to this pad after using the Klymit static v for 3 years. What a difference! Comfort, insulation, this pad is great.
review.name: Great Pad

review.reviewBody: Borrowed one of these from a friend for a multi-nighter. The extra width was a nobrainer and lead me to buying my own.
review.name: This pad sold me on extra-wide comfort

review.reviewBody: These are super nice pads. Quite, warm and light, you can't beat these. The pump sack is amazing. They pack great in the bag and don't take up too much space.
review.name: Awesome pad!

review.reviewBody: My experience with the Nemo Tensor Trail sleeping pad has been great. To start off, the vortex pump sack is fantastic for inflating the pad. The pad has a 2.6 R value, which is fantastic for the Pacific Northwest's moderate climate. I used this pad on the Lost Coast Trail and across the Trinity Alps. It has helped fantastically in all conditions. Also, bear the extra weight and get the wide pad.
review.name: Great for the Pacific Northwest!

review.reviewBody: Would buy this again and again and I have. I recently got my bike and all my gear stolen bike packing in Canada. I definitely question all my gear choices when I have to rebuy things but not this. It's so light but still tough. Has held up will even when I'm just sleeping in a ditch.
review.name: Would buy this again and again!

name: Tensor Trail Sleeping Pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good fit, good quality.  Keep me dry in the elements.  Light weight, but durable.
review.name: Not just another rain jacket.

review.reviewBody: I share the concern many other reviewers offered--that to put my hands in my pockets I will have to risk water running down into the vents.  I think zippers running the other way would have been better.  But I haven't tried this in the rain yet, so we'll see.
review.name: Cute!

review.reviewBody: Could you make this in red or purple and without these lines? These lines look like tied up a package for shipping😝
review.name: Other colors without lines
comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us, we will be sure to pass this information to the appropriate teams for future improvement.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had a reversible white OutDry jacket for 10 years. Best rain jacket is ever had until the hood tie broke. I was so excited to see this new version. It's an incredible jacket and stylish - except for what is ultimately the reason I'm returning it. Why oh why did Columbia need to put a logo in the mid-center back, low enough where the hood doesn't cover it. There is already a logo on the chest and an OutDry logo on the sleeve. The logo on the back is unnecessary and ruins the jacket for me. I was willing to pay full price for this jacket because of how waterproof, stylish and versatile it is. All ruined by excessive branding.
review.name: Great jacket - if you're OK as a walking billboard

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This just arrived yesterday so I haven’t worn it in the rain yet but it’s a great jacket. Looks good and well made. My only complaint is the bright red sticker on the wrist, it totally detracts from the clean look of the jacket but there is no way to remove it. I bought the XXL and it fits perfect with enough room to wear a sweatshirt underneath (normally wear a 2x or 16W).
review.name: Good looking rain jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Keeps the rain out, fit is great, even over the bulky sweaters
review.name: Best Rain Jacket Ever!

name: OutDry Extreme Wyldwood Shell - Women's

review.reviewBody: I think the name hoody made me expect something slightly weightier/warmer for use in spring/autumn, but it proved very useful as an extra light layer for walking/biking in otherwise very warm weather abroad and packs down to nothing. Fit is mostly very good (size 8) other than the neck hole being a little tight to get your head through. Lovely bright orange colour (red grapefruit). Washes beautifully and dries super fast. Think of it as a very light and breathable T shirt with long sleeves which happens to have a hood, rather than a "hoody". Great for travel.
review.name: Summer use only as extremely light material, neck a little tight but otherwise a useful purchase

review.reviewBody: Brings back memories of many great adventures. Still the best of all the freeze dried foods. Thanks to Moutain House for bringing it back. Bought a bunch for emergency rations and make occasionally as a quick meal.
review.name: Nostalgic

review.reviewBody: I don’t know if it is because we are exhausted after a long, hiking day or if the mail is just that good but after hiking all day with two kids, they scarfed it up thank goodness we had some instant potatoes to go along with it or mama would’ve been left out. Definitely a good option on the trail.
review.name: Yummy & filling

review.reviewBody: Beef Stroganoff is one of those comfort foods that is always good. If you read the title, I am trying to stock up on supplies just in case things get sketchy. Thanks for your understanding!
review.name: Getting Ready For SHTF Event, If It Ever Happens?

review.reviewBody: Tried this out and it was delicious. It took a bit longer for the meat to rehydrate, but the taste was satisfying and comforting.
review.name: Easy and Tasty

review.reviewBody: Honestly, the best beef stroganoff we've ever had.  Even better than any restaurant.
review.name: Best Beef Stroganoff Ever!

review.reviewBody:
...That has relied on and enjoyed this meal in many different circumstances and have never once been disappointed in it.  Nice reward at the end of an honest outdoor effort. 
The nostalgic throwback classic is also appreciated.
review.name: Long time consumer...

review.reviewBody: This has got to be my all-time favorite!  Tender  curly noodles, nice pieces of juicy beef, and a great sauce.  Love it!

review.reviewBody: Not overly seasoned, deeeelicious and filled me and my wife
review.name: Tasty and Filling

review.reviewBody: Beef Stroganoff Classic is delicious.  Seemed to have more mushrooms in the Classic recipe, but may have just been a coincidence.   Great having the extra serving when you are sharing and working outdoors in these cooler temperatures.    Gotta love a Classic!
review.name: Great flavor and more servings

review.reviewBody:
Here's the problem, you can't have it all. Nope. For starters I LOVE this jacket. I'm on my second one after nearly a decade. I know exactly what it is and exactly what its not. It's ALWAYS in my pack or my luggage. It's light and compressible. The fabric has a brushed finished so it's quiet. It's of course a fantastic windbreaker. It's got solid pit zips. It's stretchy. But it's not gonna keep you dry on a 3 hour hike in a PNW downpour. It's not marine grade foul weather gear. It's not even a 3-layer hardshell. It will keep you dry running the garbage can to the curb or taking fido out for a quick one. It works in a light rain/drizzle. It's perfect for that 45min Summer shower in the Sierra or Rockies while you wait most fit out under a leaky tree. Its NOT 'lets go walk the dog in a Bainbridge island downpour or a jacket your gonna put on to go work down on dock on the 10th straight day of rain Greenville Maine. You can't have it all. 

So for the naive that like to post "my waterproof breathable (WPB) rain jacket leaks"... it probably doesn’t. All WPB rely on the DWR to shed water. Once that DWR fails the exterior of the jacket "wets out"... meaning the outside stars to absorb and hold water. The second that happens you are now hiking in something with the breathability of a trash bag... Not just this jacket, ALL WPB jackets. And once that happens every bit of sweat goes no where and it gets wet inside your shell. This nice soft quite stretchy exterior shell, it's DWR is gonna fail in a downpour. It just does. It’s the price you pay for it weighing nothing, being stretchy and quiet and compressing into a water bottle's volume. All that said I love this jacket. It does what it does better than any other I've found.

The vast majority of rain gear made and sold is for people who going out in the rain for a very short period of time. Think about it. How often do most people spend more than 5 min. in a torrential down pour? … very few. Very few go hike, climb, boat etc for hours in the rain. The people who can’t come in? who can’t get out of the rain, 99% don’t use WPB garments.  

Manage your expectations folks. Maybe if a billionaire puts his team engineers on developing a next gen DWR that doesn't fail we will see a WPB rain jacket that truly does it all. Until then watch Elon's rocket fuselage land vertically, be amazed, then accept that you ain't Elon and manage your expectations.

Cheers.
review.name: "Rain Jacket" and "Waterproof" are very subjective.

review.reviewBody: I bought it. But sized a little tight. I had to buy the XXL rather than my normal XL. So a little big & long.
review.name: Had to Buy XXL Over XL

review.reviewBody: Excellent jacket, lightweight and doesn’t feel sticky. Good fit, not too baggy
review.name: Great rain jacket.

review.reviewBody: I expected better from this jacket. Used it backpacking on Vancouver Island this week and it soaked through in a half hour of meaningful rain. By the time I had the tent set up all of my clothing underneath was dripping wet. Despite being listed as waterproof the material absorbs water rather than repelling it. Either this particular jacket is defective or mountain hardwear doesn’t take their reputation seriously anymore.
review.name: Not waterproof at all

review.reviewBody: Premium rain shell that is prefect for hiking/vacation.
review.name: Comfortable, Packable,

review.reviewBody: Excellent shell. Very stretchy, lightweight, the right fit for layering. Great windbreaker for the Greek islands during the summer, haven’t managed to get it wet just yet.
review.name: Great Piece

review.reviewBody: Great stretchy light weight rain shell. The upper chest pocket is great and isn't offered by other brands at this price. Quality waterproof YKK zippers and construction. Packs down into its pocket and works great for backpacking.
review.name: Nice rain shell.

review.reviewBody: Pockets were not waterproof. Hand pockets were wet after a 20 min walk in the rain with the dog.
review.name: Not waterproof

review.reviewBody: Recent purchase. First use was a 25 min walk with the dog with moderate rain. Hand pockets and chest pocket all soaked through. One plus is how small it packs down.
review.name: NOT waterproof

review.reviewBody: I used this jacket in a 4-day trek in Torres del Paine in Chile and got absolutely soaked in moderate rain. The fabric layer absorbs plenty of water and I had to get a plastic poncho instead. It was a very unpleasant experience unfortunately.
review.name: Poor waterproof fabric

name: Stretch Ozonic Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Mach 4 SL V2 Pro XT/XTR 120 Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody:
So far so good. The center lock front disc was loose and it took a few attempts to figure it out. The DW link is great…expect to see it all over the place now that the 20 year exclusive patent is now expired. Fully mechanical and the last of the Line in exclusivity!
Rides super smooth and fast!
review.name: Mach 4 sl

review.itemreviewed: Mach 4 SL V2 Pro XT/XTR 120 Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody:
After maybe ~120 miles or so, I can say that this thing rips! It’s light, fun, flickable, and fast. Love how it’s predictable and doesn’t leave you guessing in the ups and downs. Climbs exceptionally well. Descends with surprising comfort.

Don’t love the cockpit arraignment of the dropper controls and suspension lock-outs. Definitely need to change that up. 

Also, really would have loved 180mm rotors for the trimming of speed on the faster downhill sections. That too is easy enough to remedy.

All in all, it’s the right choice for what I’ve thrown at it.
review.name: A Proper Rocket Ship

name: Mach 4 SL V2 Pro XT/XTR 120 Mountain Bike

hasVariant.name: Smart HMS 2.0 Screwgate Carabiner
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Smart HMS 2.0 Screwgate Carabiner online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It's a solid carabiner. The safety feature of the plastic gate not closing until the carabiner is locked could be useful in ensuring the gate is locked during use. However, I like to have by carabiners unlocked while on my harness so they are ready to be deployed quickly, and this just sits kind of awkward if it's open. That's my one nitpick.
review.name: A decent a carabiner

review.reviewBody:
It has a clever protection against cross-loading and unscrewing, but it's not always easy to operate because the massive plastic lock gets in the way when opened - it's perpendicular to the carabiner. Also, the plastic lock can fall off (happened once). Unlike other Mammut carabiners or Edelrid, it doesn't have a red open indicator, no redundancy here. After trying both, I liked the Edelrid design more, but it may be a personal preference.

For clipping into the rope on a glacier, it's reliable, especially as a safety measure for the inexperienced, supervised by a guide. Also great for rappelling with a tube device. For serious alpine climbing, I'm not sure if the extra protection outweighs added complexity and reduced versatility.

For comparison, left to right: Mammut Sender, Classic, Workhorse, Smart HMS, Edelrid Bulletproof Screw FG, Edelrid Oval
review.name: A bit tricky to use

review.reviewBody: The screw thread is quick and smooth to operate. I find the size of the carabiner to be unnecessarily large for my use.

I wouldn’t use this for belaying with a grigri- an auto locker would work better and you don’t really need the round stock, the DMM ceros would be a better option for a GriGri. I would however use this with an ATC, especially for descending as it has a round stock.
review.name: Good ATC rappel carabiner

review.reviewBody: Great size. Great for controlled environments. If needed in a hurry tho I'm not sure it would be my first choice...to many steps, but great for someone who wants that extra safety. Definitely nice to use to keep things organized
Best for rappelling, best for belaying,  best for protection from crossloads. A mammut must-have.
review.name: The best.

review.reviewBody: The construction on this carabiner is on par with other major branded carabiners and the size/shape is also on par. The thing I enjoy most about it is that it has the retainer that keeps it oriented correctly. This can be a pain in the rear at times if you're clipping in and out repeatedly, but it's also a good reminder to screw your gate closed when clipping in as the retainer won't close or function until you're completely screwed closed on your gate. Overall it's a great carabiner and helps on many fronts when climbing. This is especially helpful at preventing cross-loading while belaying someone.
review.name: It's a carabiner

review.reviewBody: Great and durable carabiner to avoid cross loading while belaying

name: Smart HMS 2.0 Screwgate Carabiner

review.itemreviewed: Canyon SPD Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I ordered these from Backcountry as they were the only place I could find the size I needed.  This is the second pair of these shoes for me.  Hopefully they'll last as long as the previous pair (approximately 2 years).  Of course I'll treat them as I did the last pair.  The weakest point I've found on all shoes is the fact that the sole separates from the rest of the shoe all too often.  I now treat the seam between the sole and the rest of the shoe with super glue.  Yet this doesn't help the rest of the shoe.  In the approximately 2 years I've owned the previous pair, the first thing to wear out is the inside of the heel of the shoe.  But given that fact, I purchase another set of these for the quality they have and better ability to fit my 12EEEEE feet.  Only one other brand can do that now.  However, finding a lace up shoe in my size gets harder and harder each year.  I'm not racer but have tried both velcro and Boa type closures as well.  Velcro doesn't last long and Boa closures give me hot spots on the top of my feet.

As to Backcountry, they are really good for having what I need and their shipping as promised is on time.  This is only the second time I've ordered from Backcountry and they've yet to disappoint.  Cudo's for a well managed business.
review.name: One of the best lace up shoes out there!

review.itemreviewed: Canyon SPD Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My package was stolen, with proof of it being ripped apart down the street, and I told backcountry about it and was told there’s nothing they can do.
review.name: Package stolen

review.itemreviewed: Canyon SPD Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these specifically for a bike trip which included walking in small towns during stops. The shoes were easy to walk in and no stiffness.  The lace up feature made them fit to my liking.  When riding they are not as stiff or firm as regular clip ins as you would expect. A traditional bike shoe is firmer and thus more supportive. I recommend these as I am pleased with purchase and trip was awesome.
review.name: Perfect for The Design Purpose

review.itemreviewed: Canyon SPD Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wanted an SPD bike shoe that didn't scream MAMIL, and would be comfortable off the bike, and these deliver. My favorite feature is the built in elastic strap to keep the laces contained and out of the chainrings. I wish all my shoes had this feature. Pearl izumi products have never let me down and these shoes are no exception. I've worn them on about 10 rides ranging from 20-60 miles on mixed terrain and they have performed well and stayed comfortable. Cycle shoes are often too narrow for my feet but not these.
review.name: just what I was looking for

review.itemreviewed: Canyon SPD Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've had these for about a month and am very happy with the purchase. Yes, the soles are stiff, but that's what I expect in a cycling shoe. I've only had Sidi shoes before, so this was a switch for me. Walking is great, and the cleats don't clack on the pavement with each step. I plan to use these for touring and commuting, but have also used in a spinning class.  The recessed area for the cleat is tight, so depending on your pedal design, clipping in and out might take some practice.
review.name: Great SPD Shoe for Walking

name: Canyon SPD Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light, portable and strong. Excellent for backpacking
review.name: Most overlooked backpacking gadget

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If part of your setting up camp at the end of a long backpacking day includes a line to hang everything that is wet with sweat or damp from rain the day before or just needs to air out, this S2S clothes line makes it easy to make that happen. It conveniently hooks to outside of your pack so you don’t have to hunt for it. Also, minimal weight to carry this item I use daily while outdoors.
review.name: Top notch clothes line

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve gone through several clotheslines in the past- some for camping and others for general travel. This one is my favourite because it’s truly the most compact one I’ve seen, can easily wrap around a tree or pole, AND has built-in clips (nifty technology). With other lines, I’ve had to come up with an intelligent way to get up the line or pack it but this is much easier.
review.name: So compact and useful

review.reviewBody: fits in the palm of your hand and will be great for camping or travel if you wanted to wash your clothes in the hotel room
review.name: Compact and Versatile

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It works and does what it’s intended to do. Happy so far.
review.name: Clothesline

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A little ingenious device I use in every single camp I set up. It works to dry my clothes, pouches, sacks, and backpacks whenever things get soggy (in the Midwest that's frequently.) It's one of the first things I get out upon arriving at a camp, and among the last things packed. It's a joy to use a product that just works - it does the job it was designed to do, and does it well.
review.name: camping clothesline for everyone!

review.reviewBody: We acquired for our family of 6 and our National Park adventures. The set up is fairly easy but the length could be better (especially for a big family). Pair it with the biodegradable soap and you are set.
review.name: Just need it to be longer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This clothesline is awesome! Love that you don't need clips! It was very easy to attach to the tree too!
review.name: This clothesline is awesome! Love

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Purchased this for my Camper Van to hang under the cabinet for drying items as needed. Definitely beats looking for a laundry place while traveling and fits under the awning anchors for camping! Haven't used it for backpack camping yet but it is a great line, adjustable lengths and the little beads hold items securely best part is it's reflective so no worries about getting tangled up as it was easily seen with my headlight. Highly Recommend!!!
review.name: Lite Line Clothesline

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was compact and perfect for doing laundry while traveling. A must have!
review.name: This was compact and perfect

name: Lite Line Clothesline

review.reviewBody: Superior helmet with the top of line protection. The retention system will fit almost every head shape and is definitely secure. The helmet is now ranked number 1 in safety.
review.name: Fits like a glove, light and tough

review.reviewBody:
This helmet fits really well, similar fit to the POC Tectal & Kortal, but a bit smaller on the head. It looks good (though I prefer the POC look still), and the GoPro mount doesn't look too bad. 

The reason I counted this one out is because of the back of the helmet retention system interferes with Oakley sunglasses. Also, I thought the retention could potentially be uncomfortable on rides. Due to sunglasses issues, it was an automatic no in my book. If you're wearing goggles, this system shouldn't be an issue. On the plus side, the retention system glues it to your head and will make it not move.

Size L weighed 390g 
POC Kortal XL/XXL (equivalent to Rex L): 440g
POC Tectal XL/XXL (equivalent to Rex L): 397g
review.name: Nice helmet but not great w/ sunglasses

name: Rex Helmet

review.reviewBody: These gloves are perfect for all sorts of weather - anything below about 45f, including rain, all the way down to extreme cold (-25 windchill). I wanted a glove that offered a closer fit than a ski/snowboard glove, but still had solid warmth and waterproof capability. This glove is it. I wear them for everything from walking the dogs and scouting the property, to errands around the city and fun nights out. I bought these in black, but I'm grabbing a pair of the tan as I think they'll be great for some of the farm work I do. I would give these 5 stars, however the thumb of the glove is extremely long and that makes them a bit fumbly. The thumb is nearly as long as all the fingers (look at your hands and imagine if that were the case). I have an extra inch or so in the thumb space but other than that these gloves are truly perfection.
review.name: Made for all the wild weathers

description: Buy the Joolca Ensuite Single online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ensuite Single
hasVariant.description: Buy the Joolca Ensuite Single online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I love this tent. I have my toilet, a little table and kitty liter inside. It’s got vents at the top to help with air circulation (and not get too hot). I have also used a solar shower. The solar shower hangs too low, so I had to squat. BUT, it did hold the solar shower. The last shelter I purchased (from a reputable vendor when I hung five gallon solar shower in it), broke. This structure is strong. I also like the pull tab on the floor to get all of the water out. 
It was also quite windy where we camped up on a ridge at 8700 feet. I put stakes in the four feet, and also guy wired four lines (included in cool little compartments near the top). I staked them down as well and it was fine in the wind. Lots of little items make it nice like a ‘dry zone’ where a flap comes down and can protect things from becoming wet while showering. I highly recommend this product.
review.name: Holds up in wind, well thought out

review.reviewBody: Went on a camping trip in the dusty Sierra Nevada Mountians. We had 4 people with us all of us showered and had an amazing experience with the tent. We loved the dry zone to keep clothes and towels dry as well as the pockets to keep shampoo and soaps easily accessible. Next I plan on getting the shower base!
review.name: First trip with it and we ABSOLUTELY love the Ensuite

review.reviewBody: I bought my ensuite single last season and it sat in storage. I finally had the opportunity to use it and noticed small holes in the bottom. Not sure it came like that or was a storage thing but nonetheless I absolutely loved having my ensuite. I don’t have the HOTTAP so I intended to use to as a privacy space for changing and using a portable potty. Since I had a separate water tank I ventured to use it to shower as well. There’s great storage spaces and air ventilation and still provides privacy. It’s so versatile and has so many uses. I just wish I bought the double for a constant dry area.
review.name: Wish I bought a Ensuite Double

review.reviewBody: Easy to set up; Holds in the heat very well while showering and has many places for shampoo/toiletries.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Overall design - the pockets, the laundry and dry areas, the hose inlet and hose clips and the draining floor. Really the best on the market.
review.name: Great shower tent! Perfect for taking showers out in the wilderness.

review.reviewBody: Everything about this shower / changing room / toilet shelter is awesome. Extremely well built and all the features were well thought out and Joolca didn't miss a beat. Might cost a little bit more then all the other junk that's out there but if you want a quality product that's what your going to get. You can't go wrong with this they literally thought it out to perfection. 10 stars

I love the fact that the floor drains along the sides. When it's hot out and the shower gets muggy inside I open the two roof vents and the large window in the back and it's very comfortable. 

It's just me so I opted for the single. I hang my towel under 'keey dry' area and it never gets wet.

Overall it's very well constructed and I expect it will last many seasons.
review.name: Perfect for camping in the woods

review.reviewBody: Haven’t had a chance to use it, but I tried setting it up and it was extremely easy. Game changer.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Quality, great size( dogs follow me everywhere), so easy to put up and then stay up. Love the multiple windows. Ea as y to clean outside and inside. Love love love it. Can’t wait to add the hot tap. Thanks Joolca
review.name: ❤️ my Joolca en-suite shower tent

review.reviewBody: Very easy to set up and break down, haven’t used in the field yet, but it seems to be very well thought out, in functionality and design. I’m very excited to be able to shower off grid.
review.name: Easy set up tent.

name: Ensuite Single
