review.reviewBody: Great belt that I use on my Vidda Pro, Keb Agile and various Abisko trousers/shorts selection. No slippage, easy to thread (even when wearing the item), extra length .tucks neatly into a loop. Solid and secure buckle. with nice detailing.
review.name: Great Belt. Perfect for my Keb Agile trousers.

review.reviewBody: Loved the idea, so I could get through airport security, but the buckle does not secure the belt and needs to be continually tightened. They graciously sewed the belt end together to secure it, but this should not be a requirement. I cut the six inch tag off when I bought it and was not able to return it.
review.name: Slipping buckle

review.reviewBody: Nice belt but too long and with no place to put the part that hangs out
review.name: Nice but...

review.reviewBody: I really liked the quality and practicality to use.
review.name: Great for everyday

review.reviewBody:
Having spent years looking for a belt that is not made of cheap metal on the “belt buckle” portion. I have finally found it. I am semi worried they’ll never make them again so I’ve already purchased another one to have on deck. 

The belt stretches, is easy to adjust on the fly, feels solid, and doesn't seem to trap sweat terrible given it’s also not made of metal I would likely feel ok washing it. 

Looking forward to putting it through its paces on the trail - it does JUST barely fit my Fjallraven pant belt loops but it's not much trouble as a heads up. Sure would be funny if it didn’t fit their pants.
review.name: I love this belt - the perfect daily belt

review.reviewBody: This belt looks nice and has a fairly good buckle system... that is about all that it has going for it. It has some elasticity to it that allows it to almost constantly loosen which pretty much defeats the purpose of the belt.
review.name: Looks nice, ends there

review.reviewBody:
This has been my favorite belt to use day to day. I’ve used it casually in the city and have take this on both hot weather and cold weather hikes. It is so comfortable to wear! The material is a bit stretchy and the dimensions are wide enough to give you proper support. 

I will add that this belt won’t fit on all pant loops, but for what I have, it fits 90% of mine. I’d suggest measuring your loops before buying the belt to ensure you can use it. 

The buckle took maybe a day or two to get used to latching on, but now have no trouble and don’t have to think about it. Its my favorite part of this belt, plastic and sturdy buckle with a unique design. 

TSA Friendly: I don’t ever have to take off my belt while traveling since there are no metals in this design. Not only is it TSA safe, but also very light-weight.
review.name: My favorite belt!

review.reviewBody:
Love fjallraven usually near perfect design and quality. This belt constantly loosens no matter what you do. It?s an elastic fabric that either doesn?t hold tight or just gives and loosens itself, either way it?s basically useless as pants keep slipping might as well not wear it. I?ve noticed the extra amount has grown over 6 months of attempted usage to almost 9 extra inches! And still not good. 
I do like the low profile buckle which is why I bought it, I wanted something slim underneath backpack belt or a harness, but this is not the solution.
review.name: Constantly loosens

review.reviewBody: I’m not that happy with this belt, it’s too wide for many of my pants belt loops, it's buckle is problematic it doesn’t easily unlatch and causes frustration most of time I’m trying to get it off and it's overly large and plasticky. review.reviewBody: This was my 4th purchase of baggies.  They’re true to size, durable, and quick drying.  I wear them for any kind of excursion, from hiking daily in the summer, to white water rafting.  But they don’t have an overly “active shorts” look so they’re perfectly fine to wear while running errands.
review.name: Never too many

review.reviewBody: I bought these in a XS, 5'1", 110 lbs. These fit great. They're quality well-made shorts and I will buy more in the future.
review.name: I love them, buy them on sale!

review.reviewBody: I’m unable to adjust the shipping, and it autofilled to the wrong address.
review.name: Unresponsive customer service and chat
comment: Hi, it looks like you were able to get ahold of a gearhead and they updated the shipping address. We sent you a new e-mail to make sure everything got to you as planned.

review.reviewBody: Four pairs of mediums and four different sizes. Not consistent at all.
review.name: Inconsistent sizing

review.reviewBody: I’m 49,  5’6.5 I weight 175 with a swimmers Athletic built. I got size large and I bought 3 pairs of the black. I absolutely love them. The 5inch is perfect for my age. I wear them daily to work. I love that they don’t have a lining like running shorts. So comfortable after washing, hanging up to dry. Will buy more!!
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: I ordered based on my measurements and could barely get these over my hips - the size guide is off. Size up.
review.name: SO SMALL

review.reviewBody: I am a size 14 which, according to the size chart, puts me solidly in the Large size category. Oh my goodness, I could barely get these over my hips. They fit, but barely. And were so uncomfortably tight that I would never hike in them. Returning.
review.name: Runs VERY small

review.reviewBody: I am a recent fan. I got these shorts on a whim but they are now my go to shorts after my Utah parks trip. Camping with no access to showers, I was able to wash and dry at my camp site. Paired with Sun hoodies, the baggies did no wrong during some hot hikes.
review.name: Great hiking shorts

review.reviewBody: In-seam too long, was longer than other 5 in in-seam shorts that I wear.
review.name: Returned for Fit

review.reviewBody: This is really a great helmet for price, and having MIPs was my main reason to upgrade an older Bell Volt helmet I had. Unbelievably poor durability which seems to suggest craftsmanship defects.
It's not like I drag my toe or smear more than others, and if I do, I put all my shoes through that, and I've never had another shoe's rubber separate within three weeks.

Disappoint. Fit and performance is meaningless if it won't last a month.

review.reviewBody: I bought these for everyday wear in 30-50 degree weather of all sorts and they do not disappoint.  Some of the best general purpose gloves daily use gloves I have ever had for keeping my hands warm.  I have a whole collection of gloves, including others from OR, that do not meet that goal.  I suspect that those reviewers that find fault with warmth or wind resistance simply did not get the right fit for their particular hand shape.  These gloves are water-resistant (not proof) for up to two hours and did allow me to check my phone but just barely, so keep those expectations reasonable. They are comfortable and let me work outside for a long time with comfortably warm and flexible hands.  Buying more so I can clean the non-performers out.
review.name: Exceptional performance

review.reviewBody:
These gloves are not good.
1. They aren't warm; in particular, my fingers were freezing in dry, 45-degree weather. 
2. The computer/cell phone touch doesn't work.  I routinely had to remove my gloves to manage my phone. 
Just pass on these, as I am sending mine back, and for the time being staying clear of OR gloves. This is my second under-performing pair.
review.name: These Gloves Aren't Good!

review.reviewBody: Fits well, however wish they came in 2XL. Believe they would fit better, use for hicking and skiing.
review.name: I would buy this product if it came in 2XL.

review.reviewBody: I run hot especially with gloves. These are perfect for me and Alaskan winter. They block the wind and give me just enough warmth to handle almost any winter day around Anchorage. Great Gloves that provide perfect warmth, allow dexterity and aren't too bulky.
review.name: Great Gloves

review.reviewBody: Having been involved with the outdoor retail industry for over 25 years, I'm no stranger to the quality product from OR. That being said, I have many pairs of OR gloves for different seasons/pursuits. It wasn't a gamble getting the Sureshot soft shell gloves in my size. (Their fit is consistent through the glove category. What I didn't expect is how much I would end up using them. Cold weather bike commuting, shoveling snow, walking the dogs and of course the perfect mid-weight glove for the backcountry. I'd like another pair just to stretch the life over the next several years. Highly Recommend!
review.name: Fits Like a Glove... Lol!

review.reviewBody: Excellent gloves for an active outing in 20-35 degrees. The phone fingers work okay, but its much easier to take the gloves off if your doing anything other than taking a quick peak at something. If you're not moving much, then these might not be insulated enough to keep you very warm.
review.name: Good for winter hikes, walks, or active outing.

review.reviewBody: Great for day to day stuff like shoveling snow or clearing off vehicles also nice for warmer days snowboarding.
review.name: Great every day glove

review.reviewBody: Those gloves are perfect fit, not the warmest but if you are doing some kind of physical activity your hands will be warm enough and cover from the cold and some snow or rain.
review.name: Love it.

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and still have enough dexterity to handle my service weapons. As the title says cool weather down to maybe 20 degrees Fahrenheit below that and your digits will be cold.
review.name: Cool Weather Glove

review.reviewBody: The fit is excellent, easy to put on and take off, waterproof enough for skiing and just the right amount of insulation for high output activity in freezing temps.
review.name: Perfect for resort skiing

name: Sureshot Softshell Gloves - Men's

review.reviewBody: Works great … very easy to use … like the magnets for cutting …
review.name: Great nippers

review.reviewBody: Well made and sharp . Works as it’s supposed too .

I figured I would spoil myself and order these because I loved the idea of the nipper having a system to help me tie on tiny flies.  Backcountry sent me a cheap pair of nippers instead.  My first attempt to get this rectified i was told the item was backordered and the correct item will be sent within a week when new stock arrives.  I asked for an email to confirm this and one was sent.  A month later still no replacement.  Called again and was now told I will have the item in a week but need to return the nippers that were sent by mistake.  So now two twenty minute phone calls later and thetime needed to return the cheap nippers Im sorry I didn't just go on the Simms website and order these nippers direct.
review.name: Should have just paid $10 more at Simms.

review.reviewBody: Overall good but expensive. I would buy them again if they cut braid - but they don’t. They need tungsten carbide replaceable blades otherwise they are just another piece of fancy average nippers.
review.name: Pretty but underwhelming

review.reviewBody: Good little nippers. Only used them a few days now so not sure how they will hold up. The magnet feature is why I bought them and it works well for me particularly with small flies.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: Well-designed, well-made, sharp blades, magnetic feature is very helpful, and useful to thread tippet through fly eye.
review.name: Excellent product !

review.reviewBody: Like the look. Didn't like one of the magnets becoming unseated and is now magnetically jammed up against the other, so that the nippers are permanently wedged open. Need to find an Allen key to rectify. I'd recommend SIMMS go with a more robust glue
review.name: Magnets can come unseated

review.reviewBody: Best nippers ever! The location of the eye cleaner is great and the fly threading magnet is very handy.

They are fantasticwith my old eyes they work great for tying on tiny Baetis, Trico and Midge patterns. They are very sharp and attach nicely onto my lanyard and zinger. Best nippers I have personally used.
Razor Sharp nippers and the whole thing seems to be magnetized, so flies stick to the nipper!  Line threading took a little practice, but seemes to be very effective with tiny flies.
review.name: Part of my "must have” inventory now!

name: Pro Nipper

review.reviewBody:
Noah's Tarp by Kelty is a quality tarp to create shade on a sunny day. We recently took this on a trip to New Zealand and used it as often as we could at the beach. First, it's super lightweight making it easy to travel with, without taking up space or luggage weight. I'd highly recommend for anyone thinking about taking this on a vacation that requires flight because of its compactness and low weight.

We primarily used this tarp at the beach. Because we were at the beach, we often had a hard time keeping the stakes down in the sand with the provided stakes in windier conditions. The stakes, by themselves, are made of good material, just not ideal for sand. Also, I'd say that ideally this tarp is not to be used in overly windy conditions without either separately purchased stakes to handle stronger gusts, or with sandbag stakes (that's more on me for not recognizing that early on than a knock on the product!) An option to sell either sand stakes or sandbag stakes along with the tarp could be useful. Overall, this tarp is made of high quality material, and when paired with the Kelty Staff Pole, you really get a lot of shade for minimal weight.
review.name: lightweight tarp/better in no wind

review.reviewBody: Just used this car camping this past weekend in the Adirondacks and it was perfect!! It was a little tricky to put up with high winds, but it held up super well once we got it situated and in place. It survived 15-20 mph gusts, mid-heavy rain and snow!! Absolutely loved it and worth the price. Purchased the Kelty Staff Poles separately and they worked well!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody:
Was pleasantly surprised to see integrated guy wires with pockets in the corners (at least on the 16?). 

Used twice and set up easy. Seems strong. Haven?t been through a wind storm yet.
review.name: Awesome Tarp

review.reviewBody:
This tarp is a nimble beast!  I've owned a Noah 9' for several years and love it. I added the 12' to my gear locker for my first backcountry trip with a hammock setup. It's plenty big for storm/winter mode. In porch mode there's room for a dance party. Tie-out points are beefy and construction is solid enough to cruise through the worst weather. 

It's not the lightest tarp out there, but I can sleep like a rock with peace of mind and that's well worth the weight equivalent of carrying an extra can of soda.
review.name: Bomb Shelter

name: Noah's Tarp

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great hiking pants, good fit, would like other color choices
review.name: Great hiking pants

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the versatility of these.  The weight is perfect.  Can’t wait to wear these on our upcoming hikes.
review.name: Love the Versitility

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used these convertible pants on a three day backpacking trip.  I liked having a zippered pocket and a side pocket on the thigh with a velcro closure.  The legs were easy to unzip when it got warm out.  The legs are a bit fussy to zip unto the shorts again while you are wearing them, but worked just fine.  The fabric is lightweight which is what I want in a summer hiking pant. The sizing seemed true to size.
review.name: Just what I wanted for summer hiking

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit is a little off for sizing. Ordered a size 8 but it was loose in the waist, tight in the thighs and made climbing , bending, squatting on hikes uncomfy. The pockets are tiny so they don’t even hold the small basic tactical gear I wanted in my pockets
review.name: Size up

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Pretty good fit. Could use additional snap at the waist.  Fabric could be a bit more stretchy.  Strange long and narrow pocket not much use.  Only one small zipper pocket inside a larger open pocket.  Liked the pocket configuration for the Men's version of these pants better.
review.name: Strange pocket

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality. Very quick drying after getting wet, however, not stretchy at all so don't expect that. Recommend sizing up if you're second guessing sizing (just because there's no stretch). They are tight in the thigh on me, but I have larger than average quads. I also wish there were more pockets - why do men get so many more pockets than women? I will be keeping and wearing because they are good pants, just want a little stretch and more pockets.
review.name: NO STRETCH, SIZE UP IF YOU DON'T SKIP LEG DAY

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice quality pants. Compared to other "zip-off" hiking pants brands I own, the shorts on these pants are slightly longer, ending just above my knees. Like some other reviewers mentioned, the pants run small. I recommend getting a size up and I am glad I did that otherwise the pants would have been too tight. The pants legs are straight and fitted, so not as loose as some other hiking pants I own. Overall happy with the purchase.
review.name: Nice hiking pants, but runs small

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I would give the w’s Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pants 5 stars if they had better crouch coverage in the back. Otherwise, they’re super comfy.
review.name: Wish they had better coverage for crouching

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Odd fit.  Waist was very large.  Very tight at the knee and at the edge of the shorts.  I had to return them.
review.name: Poor fit

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Item as described.  Quality as expected from company.
review.name: High quality

name: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Women's
